system.description: Automatically equipped in each empty hand slot.
Once per scene upon entering Crisis, you may choose a specific creature you can see that you don't have a Bond towards. If you do, create a Bond of hatred towards that creature.

effects.name: Heart of Darkness
effects.description: Once per scene upon entering Crisis, you may choose a specific creature you can see that you don't have a Bond towards. If you do, create a Bond of hatred towards that creature.

system.description: You have learned to channel your vital force into your attacks. You may use an action to perform a Shadow Strike: roll your current Might die and lose an amount of Hit Points equal to 【the number rolled on your Might die】. If this didn’t reduce your Hit Points to 0, you may perform a free attack with a weapon you have equipped: if this attack hits one or more targets, it deals extra damage equal to 【SL + the number rolled on your Might die】. However, all damage dealt by this attack becomes dark and its damage type cannot be changed.
As long as you are in Crisis, you deal 【SL × 2】 extra damage (be it with attacks, spells, Arcana, items or any other method).

effects.name: Adrenaline
effects.description: As long as you are in Crisis, you deal【SL × 2】extra damage (be it with attacks, spells, Arcana, items or any other method).

system.description:
Once per session, you may spend a Fabula Point to create a new Bond towards someone or something, or add an emotion to one of your existing Bonds; this doesn’t require an action, but during a conflict it can only be done on your turn, while no effect is being resolved. Explain how destiny affected your relationships!

  • You Lose: @LOSS[1 fp]

You gain a number of extra Bond slots equal to 【SL】 .

Additionally, when you invoke a Bond to improve the Accuracy Check of an attack, that attack deals extra damage equal to 【the strength of that Bond】 .

summary.value: Today you shall know the full extent of my suffering.

system.description:
ALSO: Avenger, Black Knight, Death Knight

Darkblades are somber and powerful warriors who hide a sorrowful past. Due to tragic experiences on the battlefield or in personal life, their souls have developed an affinity for pain and shadow energy. An unlikely hero to say the very least, a Darkblade may now sacrifice their lifeforce to unleash mighty attacks and is able to draw resolve, power and even knowledge from the suffering they experience.

DARKBLADE FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Hit Points by 5.
  • Gain the ability to equip martial melee weapons and martial armor.

DARKBLADE SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.JPVEY9p8zsGidKJq]{Agony} (SL5)

After you deal damage to one or more creatures, if you have a Bond towards at least one of those creatures, you may recover 【SL × 2】 Hit Points and 【SL × 2】Mind Points.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.CEP3nER80UBDH7a9]{Dark Blood}

As long as you are in Crisis, you have Resistance to dark damage and poison damage.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.e6ids95gOPher40d]{Heart of Darkness}

Once per scene upon entering Crisis, you may choose a specific creature you can see that you don’t have a Bond towards. If you do, create a Bond of hatred towards that creature.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.YkMaFGnNoWMo6k1U]{Painful Lessons} (SL3)

After another creature causes you to lose Hit Points (with an attack, a spell, or any other method), you may immediately perform the Study action on that creature (see Core Rulebook, page 74) for free. If you do, gain a bonus equal to 【SL】 to your Check.

Remember, you can study the same aspect of a creature only once.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.W5hE9L8x7AsJI7a1]{Shadow Strike} (SL5)

You have learned to channel your vital force into your attacks. You may use an action to perform a Shadow Strike: roll your current Might die and lose an amount of Hit Points equal to 【the number rolled on your Might die】. If this didn’t reduce your Hit Points to 0, you may perform a free attack with a weapon you have equipped: if this attack hits one or more targets, it deals extra damage equal to 【SL + the number rolled on your Might die】. However, all damage dealt by this attack becomes dark and its damage type cannot be changed.

summary.value: I'll just have to become stronger than you!

system.description:
ALSO: Berserker, Brawler, Viking

Furies never know when to quit. In battle and life, they are energetic, determined, and often restless. Whatever ideals or desires drive their actions, they will stop at nothing and risk everything in order to achieve them. Some Furies undergo a rigid training in order to control their emotions; others simply see might as the solution to all problems and are constantly on the verge of letting rage get the best of them.

FURY FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Hit Points by 5.
  • Gain the ability to equip martial melee weapons and martial armor.

FURY SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.DniA4VMTBNhk5a1v]{Adrenaline} (SL5)

As long as you are in Crisis, you deal 【SL × 2】 extra damage (be it with attacks, spells, Arcana, items, or any other method).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.oi2LgAoLN5IyuBG3]{Frenzy}

Your Accuracy Checks with brawling, dagger, flail and thrown weapons trigger a critical success if both dice show the same number (and the Check is not a fumble).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.wezEekAOYfbxrt74]{Indomitable Spirit} (SL4)

When you spend one or more Fabula Points, you get an additional benefit — choose one option: you recover 【SL × 5】 Hit Points; or you recover 【SL × 5】 Mind Points; or you recover from a single status effect of your choice.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.XaopYEAay9e86srI]{Provoke} (SL5)

You may use an action and spend 5 Mind Points to perform an Opposed 【MIG + WLP】 Check against a creature you can see — describe how you taunt them! If you succeed, the target suffers enraged and is compelled to focus their attention on you (their attacks and offensive spells must include you among the targets if possible). This compulsion ends if you fall unconscious or leave the scene, if the creature is no longer enraged, or if they are successfully provoked by someone else.

You gain a bonus equal to 【SL】 to your 【MIG + WLP】 Checks for this Skill.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.OW3xxi09kANGy2ZO]{Withstand} (SL5)

When you perform the Guard action, if you choose not to provide cover to another creature, you recover Hit Points equal to 【SL, multiplied by the highest strength among your Bonds】 and choose Might or Willpower: you treat the chosen Attribute as being one die size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the end of your next turn.

summary.value: What we seek is to help people, not words of appreciation.

system.description:
ALSO: Champion, Chosen One, Savior

Often written in legends, a Hero is the embodiment of light and hope in a land plagued by darkness and despair. Together with their fellow companions, heroes travel the world seeking to help people in need and defeat forces of evil. Their only true reward, is maybe one day being remembered by those whose lives they impacted.

HERO FREE BENEFITS

  • Permanently increase your maximum Hit Points by 5.

  • Gain the ability to equip martial shields, and choose one: gain the ability to equip martial melee weapons; or gain the ability to equip martial ranged weapons.

HERO SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.MCrVhNlP4jbzdJi6]{A Hero's Purpose} (SL3)

Once per session, when you save one or more NPCs from danger, complete a quest for one or more NPCs, or one or more Villains reach 0 Ultima Points while you are present on the scene, you gain 【SL】 Fabula Points.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.4NcCRrGyuuOrgI8J]{It Was Destiny}

Once per session, you may spend a Fabula Point to create a new Bond towards someone or something, or add an emotion to one of your existing Bonds; this doesn’t require an action, but during a conflict it can only be done on your turn, while no effect is being resolved. Explain how destiny affected your relationships!

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.qg39quSjbKuvHLPo]{Power Of Friendship} (SL2)

You gain a number of extra Bond slots equal to 【SL】 .

Additionally, when you invoke a Bond to improve the Accuracy Check of an attack, that attack deals extra damage equal to 【the strength of that Bond】 .

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.iIBms0agbwthfoEz]{Resolve} (SL5)

During a conflict, you may use an action and spend a Fabula Point to recover from all status effects and also recover 【10 + (SL x 10)】 Mind Points.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.89brp9KWRYdJlvgZ]{Ties That Bind} (SL5)

When you invoke a Bond, you may choose an ally present on the scene: they recover 【SL x 4】 Hit Points or Mind points (your choice). If the Bond you invoked is with the ally you chose, that ally instead recovers both 【SL x 4】 it Points and Mind Points.

HEROIC SKILLS

“Mastery of the Hero Class” is included in the Requirements of the following existing Heroic Skills: Disarming Rhetoric, Heroic Companion, and Unbreakable (Core Rulebook, pages 235, 236 and 240, respectively), Arcane Soldier (Techno Fantasy Atlas, page 171), and Brave Bash and Cheer Up! (Natural Fantasy Atlas, page 163).

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.lrhl1WGyjTLvgV3B]{Fabula Impetum}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.DmzhRK2b6wNM1MKN]{Heroic Aura}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.V5zFlTpLppmjoXuZ]{Making Legend}

CREDIT

Class Design, Writing and Development Tails (@tailspr)

Layout by Ophan, based on the official Fabula Ultima layout by Emanuele Galletto

summary.value: This allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.

system.description: For 4 Inventory Points, this allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.

summary.value: One creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (10 Air, 10 Bolt, 10 Earth, 10 Fire, or 10 Ice).

system.description:
For 2 Inventory Points, one creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (air, bolt, earth, fire, or ice).

  • Target Suffers: @DMG[10 air], @DMG[10 bolt], @DMG[10 earth], @DMG[10 fire], or @DMG[10 ice]

summary.value: One creature recovers from a single status effect.

system.description: For 2 Inventory Points, one creature recovers from a single status effect.
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 mp].
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 hp].
